snippet: The former arena for sports and concerts, which did not deliver the economic lift that the city expected when it was built, has been unused since 2007.
abstract: Former sports and entertainment arena in Memphis, known as The Pyramid, is scheduled to reopen in spring 2015 as a Bass Pro Shops hunting and fishing superstore; empty 32-story building, a failed effort in urban development, has been unused since 2007; city, which owns structure, will rent it to retailer in effort to draw tourists and create hundreds of jobs.
lead_paragraph: The former arena for sports and concerts, which did not deliver the economic lift that the city expected when it was built, has been unused since 2007.

headline.main: Bass Pro Shops to Add a Memphis Pyramid to Its Business Empire
headline.print_headline: A Reincarnated Landmark Goes Hunting and Fishing
